7.5/10 Weakest link of the Original Half Life Continuation.

 The theme is good, you play as a soldier who try to take the control of the lab but the game fails to give an objective. In the original series the army kills the scientists and go after Gordon Freeman, but the game does not give the reason why. You get knocked in the first minutes and aimlessly go until you see that the army is leaving the Black Mesa Lab and you hear the classic "Forget about Freeman" line but from the other side as the game leaves you with more questions. I think this game should have been the game where you get some answers as you play as the "Opposing force" and give a different face and meaning to the "bad guys who you shoot on sight" from original Half Life.

 There is a few new mechanics like soldiers with professions etc. So it is an upgrade from the main game and Blue Shift.

 But for a Half Life game?, you don't have to play this game to get the Half Life experience. You can be happy and feel accomplished with only the Original Half Life, at least in my opinion.

Some sections of Opposing Force feel out of place and artificial. The gameplay additions are great, but some sections feels like cheap shooting galleries and break the spell.
However, 90% of the time, OF feels just like Half-Life.

Subject: Half Life: Opposing Force
Occupation: First Expansion for Half Life
Rating: 9/10
Comments:
This game is a great followup and i think that if it was labelled Half Life 2 people would have enjoyed it back in the day. It adds more weapons, mechanics, and good level design. Every part of the game has been improved upon, that being said there is one major problem,
Everything in this game is pointless, sure it fleshes out the story a bit but no new weapons ever return, nor do any new enemies. For as fun as this game is it will forever be a footnote to the first game and that's a shame because it's really fun.
Though a lot more feels pointless than the entire game. For example you get the sniper and then immediatly head underground for the rest of the game. Why give players the sniper when after the first fight it is in it will never be used again? I feel that way with a lot of the new weapons, it's a lot of nothingness that you will only use when you run out of ammo, which was never an issue for me. If you liked Half Life then you will like this game and they are commonly sold together (i know i got them in a bundle). If you are coming from Black Mesa though this game may be a bit of an odd one for you. 
Honestly, it's probably my favorite half life game but it will always be overshadowed by the main series. Which is a real shame.
It's bad and good expansion pack at the same time.
super fun and fast paced. best half life expansion in the series.

Did I enjoy? The game? Yes. Is it worth 5 bucks? Maybe. Is it better than Half Life 1? Defintely not.

I knew that this was originally a DLC, and that it isn't supposed to be long, but 8 hours? This doesn't even reflect the actual time it takes to play this (I am pretty slow when it comes to FPS games, and I also had to load my saves a lot).
This game gives you a new perspective, you are now playing as the "meanie", the one sent to massacre Black Mesa and kill Freeman. I like this new perspective and find it a good addition to the lore of the franchise. 

You get new weapons and new enemies (which are challenging, I have to admit). The weapons are really cool and useful (Also, you get 3 new Alien buddies instead of just one like in the base game).
My favorite part of the game was the first boss, the Pit Worm, mainly because it was just one long puzzle. Yeah I am aware that it's a straight copy of the Tentacles from the main game, but who cares. It made me use my brain.

Other than the fact that it's short, the only thing that made this such a letdown was the ending. Not the cool Gman cutscene, but the final boss. It took me more than an hour to beat a 15 minute boss, mainly because my rockets went through the boss instead of actually hitting it, which made me think that I needed to target other parts of the boss's body instead of the parts that actually take damage. The boss was so boring that I thought that I still had 8 more hours ahead of me, And I was so disappointed when I saw the Gman appearing in front of me and the credits starting to roll by.

Overall, it was a fun revisit to the Half Life world, but it was just hyped too much. I recommend you play it, but don't get your hopes up.

I like this expansion, it's cool, but holy cow, the game threw so many hard enemies to kill, especially in that sewer part. It was nonstop horror!  This one is more challenging than the original game and Blue Shift. Other than that, it's really fantastic, and I definitely recommend playing it if you're a Half Life fan.

This DLC is one of the best I've played for Half life , In this DLC you can play as Adrian Shephard one of the soldiers what should kill Gordon Freeman
Gameplay time: +-1h 30mins

[h1] Better Than Blue Shift, With A Hint Of Not **** [/h1]

This is the expansion to Half-Life you need. It tells the story of the military sent to clean the alien threat from Black Mesa while eliminating any witnesses. You are Adrian Shephard and you don't actually take part in the "eliminating witnesses" part. Instead, you are a badass soldier who is very much like Gordon Freeman, a one man army with a wopping selection of weapons to choose from. You gain more than Gordon does and each one is creative to a degree and somewhat helpful to traversing the terrain or unleashing hell.

The story is simple, as described, but like Blue Shift, your actions interlock with Gordon's as he is causing chaos around Black mesa. You always seem behind him, but eventually move onto a different path as another bunch of alien races interfere with a war between the US military and Black Mesa itself. There's less of a horror side to this expansion, as you feel more like Marcus Fenix, feeling almost bulletproof. It's a blast playing as this soldier, there's so many more enemies to blow away and more varied ways to eliminate them. Overall though, it's more Half-Life with some great additions, even if it can feel a bit much at times.

That's a lie. This game ramps up in difficulty at some point. The new aliens are there to push you against a corner and the Black Op soldiers punish your ammo. You'll see less standard, recognisable enemies. They are nothing to your arsenal. The difficulty is welcome at times but other times the AI is too quick to react to your movement and they will fire first when you turn a corner. 

Besides that, the only other negative I have is how there's less dialogue. You don't have scientists telling you what's happening or what you're meant to be doing at times. I got stuck in an elevator shaft with hanging sparking wires indicating danger. I didn't know I had to climb the safe rope to get higher as I saw a welcoming path at a lower level and so there I spent a while walking in circles wondering where to go next. Who would think a rope would be climbable in a Half-Life game, especially when it looks just like the sparking wires next to it.

But yes, this game is great and offers a good side story with about 3 hours worth of gameplay if you take it slow. It's worth replaying to pick up on the details that link to the core game but yeah, get when it's on sale and have fun slaughtering aliens.

HλLF-LIFE: Opposing Force is an expansion for the base game that brings something completely new to the table. Brand new weapons, such as the M249 and the Desert Eagle, and new enemies, such as the Race X, a species of aliens that came to Earth for a summer vacation. You play as the "opposing force" from the original game: the military. This provides a completely unique viewpoint of the Resonance Cascade. Easy recommend. Play this after Blue Shift, if you even bought that in the first place.

Half-Life Opposing Force-дополнение к основному истории HF от Gearbox. Действие игры происходит всё в той же ''Black Mesa'' только от лица другого персонажа-Адриана Шепарда, капрала морской пехоты. После провала миссии Адриану приходиться самостоятельно и иногда с помощью других солдатов HECU пробираться через комплексы ''Black Mesa'', сражаясь с существами из Зена, расой X, чёрными оперативниками. Геймплей практически не изменился.Появились новые виды оружия (M40A1,M249 и т.д). Вместо фонарика теперь есть прибор ночного видения. Теперь в команде с вами могут быть и другие солдаты HECU, не успевшие эвакуироваться. Они довольно полезные, могут подлечить,взломать двери и помочь в сражениях. Данное дополнение более подробно раскрывает что происходило в комплексе во время ''путешествия'' Гордона в Зене. Появилась ''Раса X''-раса неизвестных существ во главе с ''Геночервем''-главным боссом. Чёрные оперативники стали появляться куда чаще, чем в HF. К тому же стало известно, что произошло с Чёрной Мезой. Геймплей не заставляет скучать(хоть почти и не изменился). По итогу-это отличное дополнение к основному сюжету Half-Life.

It is like this there is electricity that is blocking your path you have to shoot something to get rid of it. I didnt know that at the time so I just walked through and died and it brought me back to the the first part of half life 1 before gordan got his hazard suit. It was obviously a broken segment because the scientists were running on the chairs and when I got to the first loading zone the game crashed. But anyway I would recommend this game on EASY difficulty.

В этом дополнении появились новые враги и новые инопланетные и не очень пушки. Единственный минус - под конец может стать сложновато из-за сильных врагов, но в целом это приятная покупка для оценивших игру и желающих добавки.

去年暑假通关的。针锋相对的内容比正传要丰富不少，加入了Race-X这个新种族，多了很多新武器，可玩性强很多。不过有缺憾的就是和正传剧情有冲突吧。如果看不懂剧情可以去找一下中文字幕包。

下面是我在游戏时遇到的问题和解决方法:
1.有些玩家可能发现进入游戏刚走没几步游戏就卡住了，然后闪退，这个问题很好解决，把大写锁定打开了应该就没事了(应该是输入法的问题)！
2.鼠标乱弹的问题，把设置里面，鼠标选项卡的最后一个英文选项勾上，然后再点应用，也能解决这个问题。
3.电梯停下后不能移动的问题。在游戏后期进入生物实验所，有个电梯在停下之后(后面也有好几个电梯)会出现无法控制主角移动的问题，解决这个问题，只要在电梯快到的时候跳一下(就是在电梯停住的那一瞬间不要接触到地面)就可以了。

最后要说的就是，可能有些玩家看见画质就被劝退了，毕竟都9102年了，这游戏画质也确实早已不入流了，但是可以期待一下Operation: Black Mesa(黑山基地行动)，它是针锋相对起源引擎重制版，还有Guard Duty(守护任务)，蓝色行动的起源引擎重制版，两者类似黑山基地起源(注意不是同一个工作室的作品)，不过也都是有生之年系列了(ㄒoㄒ) 。

Half Life da deli gibi bizi öldüren askerlerin gözünden Black Mesa felaketi.  Opposing Force valve değil bir diğer ünlü firma Gearbox tarafından yapılmış. Hikaye derinliği yerine bu sefer aksiyona yönelinmiş. Özellikle askerler ve blackopslar arasındaki mücadele efsane. 20 sene sonra yine harika.

From a first-timer who never played the original Half-Life.

Will get your blood pumping; Good weapon and enemy variety. It can get tough in certain sections, but, in a fun way.

Enemies are surprisingly smart, albeit some jankiness in their movements.
Interesting environments that show a story; Combined with interesting dialogue that makes this game really immersive, despite the old graphics.

The small alien sections were fun and didn't last too long; I heard it was a negative in the original Half-Life.
